edu.sjsu.cs.cs151.checkers.model

Class Checker

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.sjsu.cs.cs151.checkers.model.Checker

  • public class Checker
extends java.lang.Object
    Checker is a representation of a given tile on the checkerboard.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Checker(boolean canHoldPiece, Piece piece)
      Creates a new checker

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clearPiece()
      clearPiece removes a piece that is occupying the current Checker by setting it to null.
      void deselect()
      deselect turns the isSelected flag to false, allowing Board methods that would previously affect this Checker to ignore it instead.
      Piece getPiece()
      getPiece returns the piece that is occupying the current Checker, if any.
      boolean hasPiece()
      hasPiece determines whether a piece is currently occupying the current Checker.
      boolean isSelected()
      isSelected determines whether this particular Checker on the board has been selected.
      boolean isValid()
      isValid returns the boolean field canHoldPiece.
      void select()
      select highlights this particular Checker object to be used in other Board methods by setting the isSelected flag to true.
      void setPiece(Piece piece)
      setPiece sets the Piece occupying the current Checker to a different object.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Checker

        public Checker(boolean canHoldPiece,
               Piece piece)
        Creates a new checker
        Parameters:
        canHoldPiece - - If this Checker can hold a piece
        piece - - Piece to initialize with

    • Method Detail

      • hasPiece

        public boolean hasPiece()
        hasPiece determines whether a piece is currently occupying the current Checker.
        Returns:
        - 1 if the piece element exists; 0 if the piece element is null

      • clearPiece

        public void clearPiece()
        clearPiece removes a piece that is occupying the current Checker by setting it to null.

      • getPiece

        public Piece getPiece()
        getPiece returns the piece that is occupying the current Checker, if any.
        Returns:
        - a Piece object, or null if there is no such Piece

      • setPiece

        public void setPiece(Piece piece)
        setPiece sets the Piece occupying the current Checker to a different object.
        Parameters:
        piece - - the new piece to be placed on the Checker

      • isSelected

        public boolean isSelected()
        isSelected determines whether this particular Checker on the board has been selected.
        Returns:
        - 1 if selected, 0 otherwise

      • select

        public void select()
        select highlights this particular Checker object to be used in other Board methods by setting the isSelected flag to true.

      • deselect

        public void deselect()
        deselect turns the isSelected flag to false, allowing Board methods that would previously affect this Checker to ignore it instead.

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid()
        isValid returns the boolean field canHoldPiece.
        Returns:
        boolean
